text: hello that is Bill Cunningham and the
fashion story in New York this week is
black and white but caught my eye with
these large black circles on white
skirts or in the evening on the
strapless dresses in the morning the
daytime I started two women out of the
corner of my eyes suddenly passing each
other in the same spirit one woman had a
sense of humor about it she was laughing
when she saw the other woman passing
right by her then at the Metropolitan
Museum
I saw three women in the same Marimekko
fabric which has been licensed by
manufacturers and turned into skirts and
dresses add to that if you wish New
Yorkers fondness for dogs and you've got
two marvellous looking dogs with their
black eyes just dripping right down into
the black ears I thought that was
terrific the young man came down the
Avenue on his way to work all in black
and white he just looked great and then
the sense of humor when he passed by the
back was missing of the black jacket and
it wasn't missing it was in the design
and it was the two sides of the jacket
were tied together
most men carry their jackets till they
get to an air-conditioned office this
young fellow is going right along and of
course it's not a design many people
could get away with but young people
love experiments in fashion design it's
kind of refreshing though as we get to
the middle of summer to see this kind of
old chestnut black and white come back
with a force
I suppose because it's so easy to people
to put together it's almost effortless
but it really isn't it takes a lot of
thought to get the proportions and the
balance correct so it's not just
something you jump into but for this
time of year I thought it was a terrific
look
Oh
